alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Lake Casitas; Ojai Valley; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 9:18AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: .With a faster storm track, the Flood Watch has been updated for earlier start time (Sunday 10am) over Los Angeles County, and earlier end time (Monday 10am) everywhere. A FLOOD WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR VENTURA COUNTY AND A PORTION OF SANTA BARBARA COUNTY SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Ventura County and a portion of Santa Barbara County * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from expected heavy rain may result in flooding of creeks, roads, urban areas, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical system Hilary will move over southern California and bring the potential for heavy rain and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Avoid travel on Sunday into Monday, especially in the mountains. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
